title: Set the 'Consolidate Word or PDF output in a single file' checkbox to false or unchecked by default
author: Maybeleen Matammu
content: Request to implement an option to set the 'Consolidate Word or PDF output in a single file' checkbox to false or unchecked by default. Currently, the only way to do this is by removing the FP0 and DefaultPDF parameters. However, some customers require their documents to be generated as a PDF file.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea. We are deferring at this time as the desired document output can be achieved with existing parameters today.

title: Enhanced Object Retrieval for Formula Builder in Orgs with Numerous Objects
author: Dhanie Bermas
content: To improve the efficiency of the Formula Builder, we propose an enhancement that optimizes object retrieval in organizations with a large number of Objects. Currently, the process fails due to Salesforce time limits when there are too many buttons, resulting in lengthy retrieval times. This enhancement will ensure that the Formula Builder can handle large volumes of Objects more effectively, reducing processing time and preventing timeouts, thus enhancing overall usability and performance.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea, I have moved to future consideration

title: Include Quarterly Frequency for Conga Batch
author: Emeryll Monique Emelo
content: The Schedule feature currently offers only daily, weekly, and monthly options. We would like the ability to schedule Conga Batches on a quarterly basis without resorting to intricate workflows.

comments.content: Thank you for the idea. As Composer Web App takes shape on the Conga Revenue Lifecycle Cloud, we will be creating a new scheduler and will include additional frequencies that batch processes can be run.

title: A way to include plus signs in hard coded emails.
author: Austin Miller
content:
When plus signs are used in a Conga Solution syntax, it is read as a space once it has been converted to a URL. When using parameters such as EmailCC, EmailAdditionalTo, and EmailBCC, you could run into issues if any of your email addresses include a plus sign.
 
Lets say we have a field that holds CC recipients we would like to use with our Composer button. If any of these emails have a plus sign, they will not populate correctly as the plus sign will not exist when sending out the email. It would be nice to see a way around this.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea. I have moved to deferred at this time

title: Conga Batch/List View L
author: Atta Mmorosa
content:
Salesforce sent this customer the following recommendation to implement within the conga composer + batch solution however the product does not work like this at this time. The customer was going to request an idea in this regard but we in TS have gone ahead to create and attach to the case archive for documentation purposes.
 
In the solution, the same 50 MB PDF file gets created, but to create a Salesforce file from it, using code, you chop up the PDF into pieces and send each piece separately to Salesforce and then, again using code, re-assemble the pieces into a single PDF file.

comments.content: Hello, thank you for your idea. We will be deferring at this time.

The error Maximum size of request is 52428800 bytes was firing when the solution tried to attach a file to the record where the size of the file was larger than around 40MB.  Salesforce confirmed there was an intentional limit of how large a file you can create via the API.  They suggested to chop up the file into pieces, send each piece separately, store the pieces temporarily in Salesforce, and then re-assemble the pieces once each chunk is in Salesforce.

Title: Correction - Conga Batch/List View Running into Error Maximum size of request is 52428800 bytesArticle from SF - Error 'Maximum size of request reached' when you import Attachment or Content (salesforce.com)

title: Ability for Composer API to retrieve private images (base64 strings)
author: Colton Lederer
content:
Images are a vital piece to the doc gen process and if Conga wants to continue being a leader in this space, we need creative methods to retrieve images. Images can be stored in SharePoint, external portals and other repositories that are not public. It's rare that customers are trying to merge in public images.
 
Please allow Composer to accept base64 strings for images.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea, I have moved to "future consideration".

title: picture switch in excel templates
author: Dhanie Bermas
content: Customer is using an excel template and is wished to format a date field to dd/mm/yyyy which then needs to be merge as a PDF output. The picture switch functionality would be a lot easier and user friendly rather than doing the formatting in excel.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea, I have moved it to "future consideration".

title: Ability for user to be notified upon Batch and/or Trigger failures
author: Jeff Ercolani
content: Multiple customers of Batch and Trigger have found it frustrating that when there is a failure in a Trigger for a record or multiple records in a Batch, the only way to be aware of these failures is by periodically checking the Workflow Dashboard. These customers have all requested functionality that notifies an admin or other user, either with an email or in-Salesforce notification or whatever's easiest to implement, when an automation failure occurs and on which record(s).

comments.content: Thank you for your idea, I have moved to "future consideration".

I would encourage an email for this use case. It can't be ignored that other services will email admins when errors occur (including Salesforce). So, this would be consistent across the ecosystem and scale to the platform solution as well. Thanks!

title: Option to create a summary page / cover page when using Batch
author: Mark Turner
content:
We have had a request to enable a feature that when creating consolidated Batches, it should be possible to create a summary page and / or cover page. The request is to also be able to use dynamic mergefields on the cover / summary page.
 
"We just want to inquire about a way to prevent a cover page from repeating itself when mass generating documents and merging them in a single PDF using conga batch from the list view.
 
We would like to know if there is any parameter or configuration that will help us prevent the cover page from repeating itself, so we can only showcase the cover page in the first page of the template and then have all the contracts generated without the cover page."

comments.content: Thank you for your idea! I have moved to "future consideration".

title: Batch "Start" button is hidden outside of the DIV visible area

content:
